title: For Militants, Founding Of Caliphate Is Win In Rhetoric, Not Reality
teaser: On the first night of Ramadan, the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria announced it would change its name to, simply, the Islamic State, declaring that the land it had captured in Syria and Iraq constituted a new caliphate. The group's leader is trying to use this new narrative to wrest control of the global jihad from al-Qaida.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
